alert.note: Alert for Pulaski (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 06 at 5:54PM EDT until May 06 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Kentucky, including the following county, Pulaski. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 553 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen in the last 3 hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Somerset, Science Hill, Burnside, Ruth, Somerset Pulaski Airport, Elihu, Dabney, Bobtown, Shopville, Valley Oak, Bronston, General Burnside S.P., Woodstock and Ferguson. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
